In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = [""]
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line * "\n")
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines for readability."
print(wrap_string(text))
